Posted: November 28, 2016
												This game picks right up from where season one left off, although not storywise entirely, so be ready for that. Let me be clear from the get go, season 2 is not as sentimental as the first one was. That may be a good or a bad thing, depending on what you feel about sentimental stuff and strong character building between two persons, but the overall feeling and the caring I had about the characters in season one I did not have in season two, or lets say it was a little bit different. However, make no mistake about it, the story is as strong if not stronger than that of season 1 and the twists and turns are right around every corner and the choices you make still somehow effect the whole game, so... that's great. Somehow although we are already familiar with the mechanics of the game, I still yurn for more of what I was just fed, just like human flesh for zombies. YUMMIE! ^^It's so cool to make actual decisions in the game and the narrative is based on the decisions that I make. Of course the decisions are a little like WWE. It's mostly smoke and not really real.By that, I mean, your decisions won't make or brake the fate of the characters, which kinda sucks, BUT, I am ok with it. In wrestling, although the fights are a great show, we know that everything has been scripted before hand and the winner is chosen long before the fight, it's a little the same feeling i get playing The walking dead series, but that doesn't stop me from "believing" and ohhhing and ahhhing for WWE or TWD, I still care and get psyched from both.And I can't wait for season three to get here, and oh, if you've read all the way up to this point, then by now you know what I am hinting at, so... GO GET... LIKE NOW, you won't be dissapointed if you liked anything of what the first season had to offer.

Posted: November 24, 2016
												From beginning to end, this is one thrill ride that nearly rivals the gut wrenching first season. If you have not managed to play the first game then stop reading, picking that episodic gem up on the cheap, beat it, then fly through this second season, as you won't regret it! My wife and I played through this together to weigh the various decisions and brainstorm ways to handle the more dramatic moments. All in all we found this a very fun / interactive way to play, as it gave room for a level of "fun" deliberation that was not always easy to pull off due to the time scenarious you're faced with. What you will get here is some of the best story telling gaming has had to offer in quite some time coupled with a unique design aesthetic that drives home the gameplay. You can't go wrong with this series; here's hoping that season 3 is just as good, if not better!

Posted: August 22, 2016
												Assuming you are aware that this is not a gameplay oriented game but a story driven, graphic adventure, click game, it's absolutely amazing. You should definitely play the first season before you start this one, obviously. The story is insanely good. It has a very emotional flashback/dream scene that on its own already captures the brilliance of the game. Furthermore, the entire while the game keeps you excited for what is about to happen, what insane plot twists are going to happen next. And it doesn't disappoint. Few moments in the game are predictable and you'll want to binge play all episodes in one go. Just buy. You won't regret it. 												Well, what can i say about this game ?...First of all, you should first buy The Walking Dead : Season 1 in order to understand what's going on, because even though there will be an intro in this game about what has happened so far, you may not get the whole picture, plus the fact that Season 1 is also a great game.This game is one of the few games that really get into you and you really look forward playing it. The way it makes you become part of it is amazing...Furthermore, it offers unique cinematic moments and you never get bored. In addition to that, it has many alternatives to the story. The only disadvantage is that these alternative choices you choose to go on with in the game, affect the gameplay/scenery only short-term. Long-term, the path is the same and the main story too. In my opinion this game and it's predecessor are a must-have, but i wouldn't pay 23 euros to buy this game, so i recommend you to buy it on the summer/winter sale , propably 5-10 euros, which is a very good price.

Posted: January 7
												So, I never thought I would write a review about this game, but I just have to after what I read from others...This game really took me by surprise. I came out of Season One thinking that there will never be a better one. And I was right... to a point. The game starts off soon after the ending of the first one. You are put into the shoes of Clementine, who is definitely a familiar character to anyone who played season one. This time you get to see what it's like to see the apocalypse from the eyes of an eleven year old girl. Telltale doesn't hesitate, and shows you its reality in the first ten minutes of the first episode. The mechanics of the game are also greatly improved giving the player an easier way to pick dialogue by finally giving us a mouse. This allows us to have more control and not accidentally pick the wrong answer like I did a couple of times in season one. The gameplay itself gets a lot more interactive and it isn't all about point and click anymore. There is a lot of mouse control and keyboard play but of course not a crazy whole amount because we have to remember; this is a story rich game which mainly includes dialogue. Just like Lee, Clementine is a character that we see change and develop through the game. Reactions and characteristics that make Clementine a character are always there, but clementine can be changed quite a lot. There are many moral choices you make that only have an affect on you in the end. Like choosing whether Clementine should smoke a cigarette or drink some alcohol. these choices won't affect the game, but it will make Clementine different in YOUR eyes. When it comes to other characters, I was once again taken by surprise at how much I cared about some of them, whereas at the same time, I absolutely hated other characters. There was a certain character that I hated in the beginning, but as I went through the game, my opinion changed. It was a pleasant change as Season One never really did. Sure there were times I thought a character I liked did the wrong thing, But I never changed opinions completely like I did here. As for the game's length, It was good. Exactly 10 hours to wrap the game up which is a bit longer than I should have finished, but I was delayed due to some very hard decisions, which I regretted straight away. Yes, I know it's basically cheating to go back and change my choices but I re-winded just a couple seconds after the picking my choice, mostly because I felt differently straight after I chose the answer. Take that however you want. The ending of the game, once again came to me as a big surprise. To a point where I had to close my eyes after choosing what to do. Then I just sat in my chair and stared at the screen waiting to see the heart-breaking consequences. Overall, Season is a masterpiece. Its story meets the level of the first season and it did not leave me disappointed. If anything, it left me empty... As if my life was over. And it made me want more, exactly like Season One did. So in the end... Season Two was not better than Season One, if that's what your looking for, then unfortunate you're doomed to replay season one again and again because you will never get such a good story with such great characters. But Season Two definitely meets the level of its predecessor. Especially with the how it concludes. Like it or not but no matter what your choices are through Season One, in the end you get the same ending. Whereas here, your choices take a big part when it comes to the end of the game. So like I did, choose wisely. Even if you need to rewind. As long as it doesn't ruin the game for you. The Walking Dead Season 2 is the definitely one of the best games I ever played and I would recommend it to anyone who completed the first one. - 10/10

Posted: July 6, 2016
												To be fair, I completed this one much faster than the first one because I now realize the story is built a certain way, and even though some decisions make the outcome unfair, you have to live with them regardless. Also, I actually played this more nonstop than the first, so I was more focused on it. At the very bottom of the review is a SPOILER ALERT, so be wary.I loved Season 2 more than the first Walking Dead Telltale game. Why? It felt much more emotional than the first, and there were way more quick-time events to keep me involved in the action as well as the storytelling. The biggest strongpoint of the first game was what happened at the end; in Season 2, that crap's happening a lot more often constantly. The characters weren't so much cookie cutter in this one as they were in the first: There were characters I started off despising, hoping they'd either get offed, or that Clementine would put them in their place, but I grew to understand them and care for them because the zombie apocalypse makes people do crazy things.The only complaint I had was how the decisions the game made me make shook my inner being because I felt like a jerk regardless of the choices I made.To summarize how I felt about the game in short: I'm preordering Season 3 when I get the chance. I think I owe it to the devs to actually pay full price for one of these games, instead of being the cheapskate I am and waiting till they're 75% off just so I can get the best bang for my buck. The game's fantastic, and outdoes the first one in my opinion with its action sequences and storytelling.***SPOILER ALERT*** ***DON'T READ IF YOU DON'T WANT TO KNOW THE ENDING OF THE GAME*** ***THIS IS YOUR OFFICIAL SPOILER WARNING***Why the hell did I and only 10% of players go with Jane at the end? I mean, did 90% of players just ignore what was going on the entire game only because Kenny is a beloved first game character? They showed repeatedly that he was done being rational, and was in fact dangerous despite Clem's attempts at showing he can still make it. Granted, I did not at all like Jane's way of handling the situation, but she was right in the end. Let's face it also: Clementine with her gained skills would still not survive on her own, so you kinda have to go with Jane because realistically Clementine would've been killed by walkers at some point since no one's watching her back; plus, the baby. An eleven year old girl is hard-pressed to survive in a zombie apocalypse on her own.And as a sidenote on the ending, I KNEW THAT GUY WAS BAD. The way his hand was rested on his lower back, I was thinkin to myself: "I bet he's got a gun, ready to shoot us if we let him in." MMMMMHHHHMMMM.

Posted: September 7, 2014
												Well, I finished the game a couple of days ago and now I have decided to finally write a review for this.  I have to say, I didn't know what to expect after the masterpiece that was season 1.  But now, I can glady say that season 2 isn't a sequel that lets it's fans down (Spiderman 3.)  In fact, you could say that season 2 surpassed season 1 in alot of ways.  Season 2 picks up right where season 1 left off and you're playing as Clementine this time around.  The way that TellTale has evolved Clementine from a tiny, defenseless girl to a hardened, rugged survivor in a horrible world is stunning.  Clementine is now a completely different type of character and you have to make hard choices that a little girl shouldn't have to make.  And that is what makes season 2 so great, the shock of having to go through terrible situations as a LITTLE girl.  It makes you feel like every choice counts and it makes you wish you could take Clementine away from all of that, but you can't.  Hopefully there will be a season 3 seeing as there are still some plotlines that are not tied up in the final episode.  In conclusion, buying this game is one of the best decisions you can make.  The game has memorable charcters, music, and story.  I'm glad to be able to say I have played TellTale's 2nd masterpiece.  (By the way, I do recommend playing season 1 if you haven't since the story won't make much sense and you won't be as connected to some charcters.)

												(CONTAINS SPOILERS FOR ALL THE AVAILABLE EPISODES!!!) ( YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!)The Walking Dead: Season 2Its awesome that they came up with a season two, i were wondering if they would do it, and i hoped for it and its so awesome that it actually happened, after season one where i actually began to cry at the end ( the ppl that knows what happends at the end of season 1 had maybe the same feelings as i had)In season two you play as young 11 year old Clementine, a girl that has survived more then a year in the horrible world. she has to take chances and hard choices to survive. even though she probably must harm people. im waiting for the last episode: no going back" to come out!in the first episode you get to meet new people: Nick, Luke, Pete, Rebecca, Alvin, Sarah and Carlos. they lock you in a shed near their camp/house because of that a dog bit you and they dont take any chances so they lock u in! im like THE HECK?! O<O ik its the right thing to do but SRSLY?! Locking up a child in a shed?!in the second episode you continue with either nick, or pete.If You Choose Pete:you get trapped in a car that delivers smoke, so you can choose to give Pete a cigarette or! if you didnt give water to the dying man at the stream that was in the woods with christa in episode one you can give your water to pete, if you want!If you choose nick:you get locked up in some sort of basement/shed/IDK!you move a wood panel and finds whisky on bottles.Nick takes one and after some drinking he offers you to drink with him, you can choose to do it or not. i chose to do it, idk why but i just wanted! XDwell nick got drunk and you can choose to let him stay in the darn place or convince him to go with youbut he is too drunk and ughh .. so he gets the deads attention, you can choose to just run or get to him. if you choose to get to him he pushes you away and shouts that you have to go and hell be fine( i think he said idontremember)SPOILERSPOILER!whatever person you choose to go with, pete dies. i was crying irl because i really liked him :"(third episode!:a strange guy that calls himself George comes to the cabin when you and sarah are the only one there because the other one is looking after pete and nick.you have a conversation with him, and he finds a picture with sarah on that you took or she took earlier in the episode. i was like WHY THE HECK DID U TAKE PICTURES?! YOU GOING TO MAKE A SCRAPBOOK OR SOMETHING BEFORE YOU DIE? WHATSTHEF***NG POINT?! IDONTGETIT!well after "george" leaves the others come back.the others gets to know who came to the cabin and the guys name is William Carver, that is described as a bad bad man so you have to leave the cabin and get to the road fast-in the next episode you reach a mountain lodge. everyone is tired after five days on the run from this bad bad man. Clementine uses her binoculars to spot the mountainlodge/skiresort and a bridge. (WHERE THE HECK DID SHE GET BINOCULARS?!)well when you reach up to the lodge, clementine climbs up to a point where she uses her damn binoculars to see if someone is following them. she spots flashlights that turns back in the forest. when clementine gets down the group is talking to someone. clementine gets trough the group as she spotts the one they are talking to, thats where the familiar face comes inSPOILERSPOILER!its KENNY!!!*^* * so happy irl*the best moment that episode.you get reunited with kenny and his friends, Walter and Sarita ( you have already met matthew but darn nick shot him -.-)WELL WE SKIp ABIT!Carver gets to the lodge and captures you, as you either gets a choice to save alvin from being shot by carver or letting him get shot because of you didnt get carvers attention of just sitting there :/well carver takes you and the remaining people to his campnext episodeYou get tied up and closed in a deliverycar/truck to "Bill" s camp. WHERE THE ♥♥♥♥ DID HE GET THE NAME BILL? ITS FREAKIN WILLIAM CARVER! ITS NO BILL!! CAN I GET A FREAKIN EXPLANATION FOR THAT THEY CALL HIM BILL? ITS PISSIN ME OFF!well you get to meet new people.....well thats enough for this time, im getting tired of writing so ima stopWELL THIS GAME IS AWESOME I RECOMMEND IT! 100/10

Posted: October 2, 2014
												It shows some weakness in a few aspects of certain episodes and there's a certain lukewarm quality to a lot of the characters, but there are a great many intense dramatic moments that more than redeem them, and episode 5 delivered such a major impact on me and made for such awesome topic for in-depth discussion that it, alone, makes this a 5-star game in my book. It kept surprising me and blowing my god damn mind, and episode 5 takes that feeling to positively stellar levels.And this game gave me such major feelings and stimulation and enthusiasm that I am nothing but glad that this is the game that has turned out to be my 100th Steam review. Such a joy to play this with my sister, and I hope other people can have this sort of pleasure as well, even IF they might constitute the sort of scumbags/idiots like the majority of characters in this game, because it's just that good. If you like an engaging story, this is some gooooood stuff right here, y'all. And definitely play the first season first for the best effect.In short, it had a few weak spots here and there, but they are more than made up for in unforgettable moments, especially in the finale, and if you enjoyed the first season, you sure as  should play this.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												pros: plenty of characters that are well voice acted, several choices to make & it is unpredictable on how it will affect things in the long run, pause function available, considers the choices you made on the first season (lets you select game save file from season 1) for story continuity, provides a good (if not better) twd experience than the TV showcons: does not have full screen windowed mode, tedious quick time events, will not allow you to skip credits at the end of each episode & makes you listen to a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ song, achievements are practically redundant for this game, typical "russian bad guys" thrown in randomly into the story, provides only <9 hours of gameplay (less content than season 1)Overall, a solid narrative game with tedious quick time events. Standard price is not worth the few hours it has to offer, so I would recommend (and for all Telltale releases that you wait until all episodes are released) that you buy the game at a discounted price.The Walking Dead: Season Two has my recommendation, but pick it up on a sale.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
												It shows some weakness in a few aspects of certain episodes and there's a certain lukewarm quality to a lot of the characters, but there are a great many intense dramatic moments that more than redeem them, and episode 5 delivered such a major impact on me and made for such awesome topic for in-depth discussion that it, alone, makes this a 5-star game in my book. It kept surprising me and blowing my god damn mind, and episode 5 takes that feeling to positively stellar levels.And this game gave me such major feelings and stimulation and enthusiasm that I am nothing but glad that this is the game that has turned out to be my 100th Steam review. Such a joy to play this with my sister, and I hope other people can have this sort of pleasure as well, even IF they might constitute the sort of scumbags/idiots like the majority of characters in this game, because it's just that good. If you like an engaging story, this is some gooooood stuff right here, y'all. And definitely play the first season first for the best effect.In short, it had a few weak spots here and there, but they are more than made up for in unforgettable moments, especially in the finale, and if you enjoyed the first season, you sure as  should play this.

content:

												(CONTAINS SPOILERS FOR ALL THE AVAILABLE EPISODES!!!) ( YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!)The Walking Dead: Season 2Its awesome that they came up with a season two, i were wondering if they would do it, and i hoped for it and its so awesome that it actually happened, after season one where i actually began to cry at the end ( the ppl that knows what happends at the end of season 1 had maybe the same feelings as i had)In season two you play as young 11 year old Clementine, a girl that has survived more then a year in the horrible world. she has to take chances and hard choices to survive. even though she probably must harm people. im waiting for the last episode: no going back" to come out!in the first episode you get to meet new people: Nick, Luke, Pete, Rebecca, Alvin, Sarah and Carlos. they lock you in a shed near their camp/house because of that a dog bit you and they dont take any chances so they lock u in! im like THE HECK?! O<O ik its the right thing to do but SRSLY?! Locking up a child in a shed?!in the second episode you continue with either nick, or pete.If You Choose Pete:you get trapped in a car that delivers smoke, so you can choose to give Pete a cigarette or! if you didnt give water to the dying man at the stream that was in the woods with christa in episode one you can give your water to pete, if you want!If you choose nick:you get locked up in some sort of basement/shed/IDK!you move a wood panel and finds whisky on bottles.Nick takes one and after some drinking he offers you to drink with him, you can choose to do it or not. i chose to do it, idk why but i just wanted! XDwell nick got drunk and you can choose to let him stay in the darn place or convince him to go with youbut he is too drunk and ughh .. so he gets the deads attention, you can choose to just run or get to him. if you choose to get to him he pushes you away and shouts that you have to go and hell be fine( i think he said idontremember)SPOILERSPOILER!whatever person you choose to go with, pete dies. i was crying irl because i really liked him :"(third episode!:a strange guy that calls himself George comes to the cabin when you and sarah are the only one there because the other one is looking after pete and nick.you have a conversation with him, and he finds a picture with sarah on that you took or she took earlier in the episode. i was like WHY THE HECK DID U TAKE PICTURES?! YOU GOING TO MAKE A SCRAPBOOK OR SOMETHING BEFORE YOU DIE? WHATSTHEF***NG POINT?! IDONTGETIT!well after "george" leaves the others come back.the others gets to know who came to the cabin and the guys name is William Carver, that is described as a bad bad man so you have to leave the cabin and get to the road fast-in the next episode you reach a mountain lodge. everyone is tired after five days on the run from this bad bad man. Clementine uses her binoculars to spot the mountainlodge/skiresort and a bridge. (WHERE THE HECK DID SHE GET BINOCULARS?!)well when you reach up to the lodge, clementine climbs up to a point where she uses her damn binoculars to see if someone is following them. she spots flashlights that turns back in the forest. when clementine gets down the group is talking to someone. clementine gets trough the group as she spotts the one they are talking to, thats where the familiar face comes inSPOILERSPOILER!its KENNY!!!*^* * so happy irl*the best moment that episode.you get reunited with kenny and his friends, Walter and Sarita ( you have already met matthew but darn nick shot him -.-)WELL WE SKIp ABIT!Carver gets to the lodge and captures you, as you either gets a choice to save alvin from being shot by carver or letting him get shot because of you didnt get carvers attention of just sitting there :/well carver takes you and the remaining people to his campnext episodeYou get tied up and closed in a deliverycar/truck to "Bill" s camp. WHERE THE ♥♥♥♥ DID HE GET THE NAME BILL? ITS FREAKIN WILLIAM CARVER! ITS NO BILL!! CAN I GET A FREAKIN EXPLANATION FOR THAT THEY CALL HIM BILL? ITS PISSIN ME OFF!well you get to meet new people.....well thats enough for this time, im getting tired of writing so ima stopWELL THIS GAME IS AWESOME I RECOMMEND IT! 100/10

content:
Posted: September 27, 2014
												The second game of the walking dead is in my opinion inferior to the first one. I also found it inferior to the fables series but that maybe because i like that world more. It still has all the classic moments from the first game and in general telltale's story telling but it lacks the impact of either aforementioned series. I still enjoyed the game and its not bad by any stretch of the imagination. Still they can and should do better. It felt a very safe approach to the game for me. Doesn't help that i pretty much disliked almost every single character except for Clementine. Also Telltale should stop pretending choices actually matter in their games, since in every game you end up pretty much with on the same path. I still will recommend the game for fans of the genre though.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												My favorite Telltale game so far and one of my personal favorite PC games, the second season of Telltale's The Walking Dead is amazing. While playing this game requires you to complete the first season for the optimal experience, doing so is worth it just for the amazingly good second season. I really enjoyed the story, the evniorment, the design, the different decisions and outcomes, the voice-acting and pretty much anything else about this game. I recommend everyone to give The Walking Dead a chance, even if you're anot a fan of the TV show and the comics (except from the fact that the game takes place in the same world as the comics, it tells a different story than the one told in the comics and in the TV show, which I personally think is much better).

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2015
												This didn't move me as much as the 1st season. In part, because the novelty factor wore off, but also because this time you don't experience as many situations in which you have to decide who lives or dies. Also, in an ironic way, Clementine is a less fragile main character than Lee ever was. She's only 11 years-old, but she can be as wise and as tough as any other adult. And, for most of the time, you don't believe that something really bad is going to happen to her. These things make this title less tense and heartbreaking than its predecessor.Even so, this still beats the TV show and it's a worthwhile ride. But I really miss the older Telltale games, with the puzzles; the "Sam and Max" titles still are unbeatable.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2015
												★★★★★ - "Do not miss this game" PROS:- Rich story which is even stronger than the first season.- In fact, this is the best telltale game I have ever played to date.- This game takes you places, the story is so imaginative and the decisions you make are so vast in consequences, often costing the lives of others.- Multiple endings, I loved this so much that I had to find out the other endings, some of which depending on how you play are so touching.- I was thinking about this game for days after completion, reflecting on my decisions as if they would effect my life.- The characters are so strong which you expect with a telltale game except this time you feel as if you meet so many more over your journey.- The return of a long lost friend.- Clementine, I thought id miss Lee but quite frankly I didn't, I loved playing as Clem and with one touching scene from the first season you can really see how this girl has grown and its feels incredible that you've taken her right through it all.- Carry over your save from Season 1, with references to your decisions at various times.- All the bugs from the first season have been ironed out.CONS:- I cannot think of a single one..except, wheres Season 3?VERDICT? Incredible game which is absolutely unmissable.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
												Season Two is the slow rise and almost certain descent of Clementine. She’s still a child, but she’s no longer innocent, and she knows what she has to do to see another day. It’s heart-breaking in a way to see how time has changed her, to hear the new edge to her voice, to see the new hardness in her eyes and to release in horror the path ahead of her, and what it pertains to. She’s no longer the moral compass, she’s no longer the little girl you try to be a better person around so she can learn from you – she is the culmination of your efforts, and now it’s your job to keep her alive, to keep her safe.Full Review // http://www.honestgamers.com/12145/pc/the-walking-dead-season-21-all-that-remains/review.html

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												First of all, if you've never played a Telltale game before, they are excellent games that everyone should try. Season 1 of the Walking Dead game constantly goes on sale so you can pick it up really cheap on Steam or Steam trading sites.If you liked Season 1 of the Walking Dead game, you'll definitely enjoy this one as well. Not much has changed art or gameplay wise, just a few tweaks of the UI; the storytelling is still top notch. While Minimal UI was not included in The Wolf Among Us for god knows why, it is thankfully included in this game. You play as Clementine in this one, after a year and a half time skip. Highly recommended if you enjoy Telltale games.

												"All That Remains" picks up nicely after Season 1's "No Time Left", it still gives you a great story and gameplay that makes this game a repeat of the first Season in terms of "Game of the Year", I highly recommend this game, prepare yourself for a FEEL trip.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												After I finished both seasons of The Walking Dead I must say that I enjoyed each and every episode of both seasons.Such a great developed game with an amazing characters, environment and questions that reveals for the player himself.Graphics are well done. Soundtrack is amazing, giving the best atmosphere throughout the chapters.It as a true story rich masteries that I definitely recommend
